revised_title: Electromotive Properties of Muscle and Muscle-Cylinder
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the electromotive properties of the frog's gastrocnemius muscle and the muscle-cylinder. They discovered that the muscle-cylinder's properties do not follow Du Bois's "law of the muscle-current." The author concludes that the part of the muscle nearest the tendon is negative, and the distribution of electrical tension on the natural surface is governed by a similar law in other muscles. This understanding helps explain the behavior of muscle-cylinders and their properties.
